 OF ISLAMIC ORGANIZATIONS IN EUROPE (FIOE) and its French member the UNION DES ORGANISATIONS ISLAMIQUES DE FRANCE (UOIF), both organizations representing THE MUSLIM BROTHERHOOD in Europe.

 the EUROPE TRUST to covertly build large Islamic facilities in European cities controlled by the MUSLIM BROTHERHOOD.

controlled by the MUSLIM BROTHERHOOD. e EMAAN TRUST She eld project appears to be focused on providing facilities for the Yemeni MUSLIM BROTHERHOOD in the UK and centers on UK converts to Islam. The project had its origins in a July 2006 application to the local planning department for the BOTHAM STREET MOSQUE AND ISLAMIC CENTRE, signed on behalf of CATALYST REGENERATION by AKRAM BONHAM (MCIAT), head of the Building Design Department.
The agent listed for the incorporation was OMER AL-HAMDOON, likely the current President of the MUSLIM ASSOCIATION OF BRITAIN (MAB) and using the address of the MUSLIM WELFARE HOUSE OF SHEFFIELD.

HAMEED AL-ASALY, pro led below, of the Birmingham-based CATALYST REGENERATION (UK) LTD was described as managing the project which was reportedly to be funded by She eld Muslims, including former World boxing champion NASEEM HAMED. No further activity on the project appears
 to have taken place until September 2010 when a new planning department les was created with the applicant as HAMEED AL-ASALY who listed the AL-EMAAN TRUST as the company. Substantial work on the project began during the summer of 2013 and there were local rumors that £2 million had “disappeared” from the project, forcing the delay. Work was expected to have been completed in June 2016.

EMAAN TRUST OF SHEFFIELD was incorporated in January 2009 and a charity with the name THE EMAAN TRUST was registered with the UK Charity Commission in September 2009. e agent listed for the incorporation was OMER AL-HAMDOON, likely the current President of the MUSLIM ASSOCIATION OF BRITAIN (MAB) and using the address of the MUSLIM WELFARE HOUSE OF SHEFFIELD.

HAMEED AL-ASALY is a 51-year-old British national who listed correspondence address in She eld that is social housing and that is also used as the registered address for the EMAAN TRUST
He was married to TRACY A ALASALY, in Sheffield in October 1997.

The project had its origins in a July 2006 application to the local planning department for the BOTHAM STREET MOSQUE AND ISLAMIC CENTRE, signed on behalf of CATALYST REGENERATION by AKRAM BONHAM (MCIAT), head of the Building Design Department. By January 2007, local media described the project as being built on land “promised to the Yemeni community” and described intense opposition to the proposed 500-worshipper capacity mosque on the part of local residents. HAMEED AL-ASALY, profiled below, of the Birmingham-based CATALYST REGENERATION (UK) LTD was described as managing the project which was reportedly to be funded by She eld Muslims, including former World boxing champion NASEEM HAMED.
